attributes.action: Amend the Planning Regulations to restrict the ability of Large Supermarket Chains to appeal against adverse planning decisions
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Major Supermarket chains, in creating massive Superstores, have the effect of destroying the small shops which are the heart of many British towns.
In an attempt to prevent this, Local Councils often oppose the plans. 
This refusal is then appealed, a long and VERY expensive process. If the refusal is still upheld, the Supermarket will continue to appeal. 
This battle of attrition carries on until the Council can no longer afford to use Council Tax Payers' money to pay the enormous legal bills.
Thus, the Supermarkets eventually manage to get their own way, regardless of local opposition  and in the process killing local town centres such as Dartford in Kent, which has been under the threat of a Tesco superstore for nearly a decade.
